* 538 BCâCyrus, king of Persia, allows Jews in Babylon to return to Jerusalem. http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/exile2.html Rainer Albertz, "Israel in exile: the history and literature of the sixth
  century BCE", p.xxi
* 535 BCâPhocaean Greek colonists clash at sea with Carthaginians and Etruscans
  in Battle of Alalia (Corsica).
* 534 BC ** Lucius Tarquinius Superbus becomes seventh King of Rome, after
  murdering the sixth king Servius Tullius. ** Competitions for tragedy are
  instituted at the City Dionysia festival in Athens.
* 530 BC ** Cyrus II is killed in war against obscure tribes. ** Cambyses starts
  to rule in Persia. ** Royal Arch Masons take this year as the epoch for dating
  their documents [[Anno Inventionis]] after the beginning of the Second Temple
  by Zerubbabel.
* c. 530 BCâTemple of Apollo at Delphi is built.
* c. 530 BCâPeplos Kore, from the Acropolis, Athens, is made. It is now at
  Acropolis Museum, Athens.
* c. 530 BCâKroisos(?) Kuoros, from a cemetery at Anavysos, near Athens is made.
  It is now at National Archaeological Museum, Athens.
* c. 530 BCâ525 BCâSiphnian Treasury, Delphi, is built.
* c. 530 BCâ525 BCâBattle between the Gods and the Giants, fragments of the
  north frieze of the Siphnian Treasury, from the Sanctuary of Apollo, Delphi,
